In childhood I preferred to play with flowers and clay in solitude and wasn't a happy child and felt incompetent and lacking self-confidence compared to other children
In childhood I received many wounds
In childhood I thought I didn't belong to my family and wasn't their child
In childhood if conflict arose between my parents I would mediate and wanted to establish peace between them
When my father and mother fought, I felt guilty
In adolescence I didn't have much connection with others and didn't participate in group activities and engaged in creative and handmade work
I'm more interested in machinery and objects than people and like technical work or manual work, and creating handmade works increases my sense of worth
When I'm upset and hurt by something, I go into myself and at this time I can engage in creating an artistic work
Making me laugh is hard work, unless I want to make others laugh myself
I believe I shouldn't talk to anyone about my inner distress and usually no one finds out about my inner self
I want to have security in life's misfortunes to be busy with my work away from life's commotion and absorb myself in work
I believe old objects shouldn't be thrown away, they might be useful someday, and sometimes I feel old objects have identity and I talk to them
My works don't have serialization and each has its own authenticity, and my feeling toward them is like a mother's feeling toward her child
I'm not competitive or collaborative in work
I don't look at my work for earning income - for me my work is a spiritual need and I don't earn much income from it
Verbal communication with others is hard for me
Many times I feel less than others and have the feeling of the ugly duckling
To retaliate against those who hurt me, I draw complex plans to put them in a humiliating situation
Many times I mock or clown myself to make others laugh
I'm very stubborn, obstinate and contrary about my thoughts and am not flexible
My spouse is everything in my life and I worship them - they're the only being in existence that exists for me and I never think of choosing another spouse
I believe in monogamy and loyalty and can go without sexual relationship for a long time and only establish relationship if I love someone
Generally in sexual relationship I'm so absorbed in myself that I neglect my spouse
Despite loving my children, I don't have the ability to express and show feelings to them, and my children see me as sullen
I'm happy when I'm in my personal workshop and alone doing work I love and no one controls me
